formElement.label: Configuration Name:
formElement.documentation: Name of the configuration to be used. URL, port and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration. To view or create a new configuration, go to the Administration -> Plugins tab, and select 'Configure' action for @PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin.
formElement.htmlDocumentation:
Name of the configuration to be used. URL, port and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration.
A Configuration defines connection details and can be created by going to plugin configuration page.

formElement.label: Connection Factory Name:
formElement.documentation: Unique name of the Connection Factory that is created.

formElement.label: JMS Module Name:
formElement.documentation: Name of the JMS module in which the Connection Factory is created.

formElement.label: Subscription Sharing Policy:
formElement.documentation: The Connection Factory Subscription Sharing Policy Subscribers can be used to control which subscribers can access new subscriptions.Values can be either Sharable or Exclusive.

formElement.label: Client ID Policy:
formElement.documentation: The Client ID Policy indicates whether more than one JMS connection can use the same Client ID. Oracle recommends setting the Client ID policy to Unrestricted if sharing durable subscribers. Subscriptions created with different Client ID policies are always treated as independent subscriptions.

formElement.label: JNDI Name:
formElement.documentation: JNDI Name is used to lookup the Connection factory using JNDI lookup. If the connection factory is created without passing this parameter, it can be only used in an Application Scoped context.

formElement.label: Maximum Messages per Session:
formElement.documentation: This limit specifies the number of messages that can be queued for an asynchronous session. Default value is 10.

formElement.label: XA Connection Factory Enabled?:
formElement.documentation: Indicates if this connection factory should create XA queues and XA topics in order to accommodate JTA aware transactions. Default is Yes.

formElement.label: Subdeployment Name:
formElement.documentation: Name of Subdeployment. Required only if you do not want default targeting and instead want to use advanced targeting.

formElement.label: JMS Server Name:
formElement.documentation: JMS Server Name. Required only if you do not want default targeting and instead want to use advanced targeting.

formElement.label: Update Action:
formElement.documentation: This parameter controls as to what the Update Action should be when a Connection Factory with the same name exists: Do Nothing (Default) - The procedure will take no action upon an update (i.e., will be a NO-OP), if this option is chosen. Remove and Create - The procedure would remove existing Connection Factory and recreate it based on new parameters passed. Selective Update - The procedure would update existing Connection Factory for only parameters that we have designed to be updatable out of the box, based on what we think makes sense.

formElement.label: Additional Options:
formElement.documentation: Use this option to pass related parameters that pertain to Delivery, Client, Transaction or Flow Control.
